intro: Chihuahuana purpusii, commonly known as the Purpus's chihuahuana, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Chihuahuana in the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
